meanings.definition: Given to joking; playful or humorous.
meanings.sent1: She has a jokey personality, always making people laugh.
meanings.sent2: The party had a jokey atmosphere with everyone sharing jokes.
meanings.sent3: His jokey nature lightened the mood during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The jokey banter between friends was like a warm blanket on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The clown's jokey antics entertained the children for hours.

meanings.sent1: The comedian's performance was jokey and had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent2: Their jokey conversation kept everyone entertained throughout the evening.
meanings.sent3: The jokey tone of the movie made it a fun watch for the whole family.
meanings.sent4: Her jokey remarks added a touch of humor to the otherwise dull meeting.
meanings.sent5: The jokey greeting card brought a smile to her face on her birthday.

meanings.definition: Intended to be humorous or amusing.
meanings.sent1: The jokey t-shirt had a funny slogan that made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent2: His jokey email brightened up her stressful workday.
meanings.sent3: The jokey prank played on him was all in good fun.
meanings.sent4: The jokey advertisement made people stop and take notice.
meanings.sent5: The jokey cartoon made her burst out laughing in the middle of the library.
